Author: jl777c#5810
Content: can anybody get z_importkey to work when specifying what height to rescan from?

Content: should add the height to importprivkey while your at it 游땔 there is no technical reason it cannot be there...

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c have you tested with sprout and sapling addrs? they are different codepaths, i think

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i know that Zcash upstream has had problems in the past with not updating the correct number of RPC args in some *import* RPCs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: perhaps the latest merge with 2.0.2 did something like that

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it kept giving parse errors.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: since curl worked i didnt spend too much time on it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c did you get `JSON error is not integer as expected` ?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: error: Error JSON:yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: kcli -ac_name=RKT z_importkey secret-extended-key-... yes 10000

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c i am looking at latest KMD FSM branch, is that correct?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: FSM is latest

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i changed yes to true, now it says: JSON value is not a string as expected

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: tried: "{\"rescan\":true}"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I just make all args to my rpc as strings

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c what about `kcli -ac_name=RKT z_importkey secret-extended-key-... "yes" 10000`

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: error: Error JSON:yes

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: ok, same

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: ok, i see a bit what is going on

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
{ "z_importkey", 2 },
it is trying to convert it

Author: dukeleto#7326
dukeleto#7326
Content: `auto rescan` is not something I see in KMD codebase a lot, i think that is the line that is failing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: needs to be in an array

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i think some kind of c++ auto-conversion is adding to the problem

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: older API is that JSON stuff, but newer api is what you are trying to tell it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: `get_str()` is failing on params[1]

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c it's arg 1, isn't it?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: 0 is privkey, 1 is rescan

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the second one, yes

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content:
i see this: ```   { "z_importkey", 1 },
    { "z_importkey", 2 },
```

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: in the conversion array

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so argument 1 and 2 are converted

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it the conversion the problem?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: was in my case .. I just added my RPC there with 1 for param 1 and now it works Thanks 游땎

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c look at z_importviewingkey. It does not convert the rescan argument

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it only does `{ "z_importviewingkey", 2 },` in the conversion table

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c my guess is to remove the `1` entry from the conversion table, but i haven't looked into git history to see why it's that way

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: perhaps it changes upstream and that didn't get pulled in

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: whenever i am in doubt, i see how a working rpc declares it's arguments and parses them

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c i am compiling/testing a potential patch now
